sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium): Specialty chemical suppliers; Na (Sodium): Chemical supply stores; Sb (Antimony): Metal suppliers; Sm (Samarium): Rare earth metal suppliers; Tl (Thallium): Chemical supply stores.
steps: Cs (Cesium): Specialty chemical suppliers; Na (Sodium): Chemical supply stores; Sb (Antimony): Metal suppliers; Sm (Samarium): Rare earth metal suppliers; Tl (Thallium): Chemical supply stores.

1. Weigh out 32.4 g of Cs, 13.8 g of Na, 28.4 g of Sb, 7.9 g of Sm, and 6.9 g of Tl using a precision balance. 2. Combine all metals in a clean, dry crucible. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to blend the powders thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the blended mixture back into the crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 32.4 g of Cs, 13.8 g of Na, 28.4 g of Sb, 7.9 g of Sm, and 6.9 g of Tl using a precision balance. 2. Combine all metals in a clean, dry crucible. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to blend the powders thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the blended mixture back into the crucible.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the metals.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the metals.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a file or sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a file or sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to prevent oxidation.
